intro: Iris sibirica var. erirrhiza, commonly known as the Siberian iris with pale yellow petals, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the colder regions of Asia. It features upright, grass-like leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wet meadows, riverbanks, and marshy areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden cultivation in temperate climates.
